prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0048, 0.0] Generate Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Face 1: Outer Rectangle and Circles 1. Draw a line segment from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. 2. Continue sketching, draw a line segment from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.6604, 0.0896]. 3. Draw another line segment from point [0.6604, 0.0896] to point [0.0896, 0.0896]. 4. Complete the rectangle by drawing a line segment from point [0.0896, 0.0896] to point [0.0, 0.0]. 5. Create a circle with its center at point [0.0524, 0.036] and a radius of 0.0044. 6. Draw another circle with its center at point [0.0797, 0.0633] and a radius of 0.0044. 7. Create a third circle with its center at point [0.6703, 0.0633] and a radius of 0.0044. 8. Draw a fourth circle with its center at point [0.6976, 0.036] and a radius of 0.0044. Sketch Constraints 1. Ensure that all lines in the loops are connected. 2. Make sure each loop is closed and does not contain any gaps or overlaps. 3. Maintain parallelism between the lines in the rectangle. 4. Keep the circles tangent to the adjacent lines. Extrude Sketch Now, extrude the completed sketch in the direction of the Z-axis with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards the normal (positive Z-axis): 0.0048 * Extrude depth opposite the normal (negative Z-axis): 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body This completes the instructions for Part 1, resulting in a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Base The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw the first face of the prism as a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 1. Draw a rectangle with vertices at [0.0, 0.0], [0.25, 0.0], [0.25, 0.75], and [0.0, 0.75]. 2. Close the loop to form a complete face. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the existing coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.25 units along the normal direction. Part 2: Rectangular Prism Sides The second part of the CAD assembly are the sides of the rectangular prism. They are built on top of the base part. 1. Create a new coordinate system relative to the first part, with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.75]. This is because the sides are built on top of the base, with a height increase of 0.75 units. 2. Draw a 2D sketch for each side as a rectangle on a plane perpendicular to the base. The vertices match the edges of the base, allowing the sides to connect seamlessly with the base. Close the loops to form complete faces. 3. Scale the 2D sketches by a factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketches into 3D sketches using the new coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 3D sketches by 5.25 units along the normal direction (0.75 units deeper than the base). Final Shape: Rectangular Prism Overall, these parts form the completed rectangular prism. The prism's dimensions are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units, as provided in the description. Join the final parts together to construct the complete prism model.</description>
